column5: Always cheaper here, in Niagara they have to compete with over the border and Haldimand has to compete with the Res, sales were dropping off too much so they drop it.
I tend to fill up on the rez here typically 10-20 cents a litre cheaper then off the rez... still no justification for these increases... its ludicrous
Thats because you are a pensioner nowdays! Lol I can’t wait to join your club! Lol

59$ a barrel today for Texas crude. It was up to 66 dollars a few weeks ago when the prices went up at the pumps. Has anyone noticed the price come down now that it's under 60$ NOT. The Oil companies continue to gouge us. I have said it before, they are conditioning us to pay 1.30 ( 3+$ american) for oil that is under 60 dollars. We should be paying no more than 1.00 at the pump for a 59 dollar barrel. SOBS
Me too. I just hope I can afford it. Don't want to be stuck in my cabin not being able to do anything because the price of gas is higher than diamonds or gold!!! ?

Just checked gasbuddy.com and from what I could see the average currently here in K-W is ~$1.14/L with the Costco price being $1.09/L, that's not as bad as small town Newfoundland back in October, Was checking google street view today of the town my mom is from & back in October it was $1.34/L (134.3) there.

Down to $1.13 today in Haldimand. For you guys counting the days until retirement, watch what you wish for. Everyone my age that has retired is on a first name basis with our Pharmacists. We talk about those good old days when we were 55.

if you want to know the real scam, check out oil prices...oil is trading at some of the lowest levels we have seen since 2003, however we are paying some of the highest gas prices we have ever seen in Canada. Just another day living in canada where we are accustomed to over paying for everything.
Yup....  The price per barrel should be reflected at the pumps..  It's definitely not.
Back before I retired in 2008 the Loonie was actually for a while  worth more than the US dollar, it being at 75 cents not does help.
Drifter, I'm at 392 days, 42 min, 28 sec......but hey, who is counting? lol
Ahh, here it is!
My countdown to retirement ended 19 years ago and I've loved every minute of the last nearly 2 decades

AHHH   yes   Retirement is great, I put in 38 years in Stelco, Hilton  Works,  Machine Shop. Twelve years ago, Now I get paid via pension plan not to come in anymore, Life is a gift and every day I am thankful for my wonderful wife, Dianne,  and family.

Retired 11 years ago here after 31 year's in the steel industry, in,  where else, Hamilton. Last few years I was one of the 2 slitter operators, got me off weekends and 12 hours shifts, no 12 hour nights was treat. Along the way I operated a crane for around 15 years then quality control for a 10 year spell making it to lead hand and waste water treatment technician for a bit, then the slitter.  Retire and save gas, we went to one vehicle and that is a 2006 just about to turn 90,000 km. ?
I've got you beat. 1996 E150 with only 80,000 km lol.

I remember when you retired Lew. I could not believe you were able to do it so young, but of course you had put in your time and paid your dues. I'm glad that the past 19 years have been decent for you. I know there were some serious bumps in the road along the way to say the least, but overall, it has been good.

Thanks Brian, nice of you to say that. I was able to retire from the Fire Dept. when I was 53 and fortunately Diane and I have stayed healthy (touch wood) and have really enjoyed life. Married 53 years this coming October and life just keeps getting better.

Well if we keep giving everyone that wants them handouts the money has to come from somewhere! 1 year mat leave, $500.00 A month per child.........pensions for life, guaranteed minimum income supliments..........
1 cents tonight and 3 on Saturday. Filler up.
Dont get me started
RAM sips and the toon runs on air and live on the lake. All good here Albert.

Just trying to help those that drive a lot and not contribute any more taxes B. I’m good for 10 days and more between fills when I work. I will top it of tomorrow even though I have  10 days off. Toon away B.
Can't wait to start trailering...
1 vehicle household, our 2006 just turned 89,000 km, not a big deal.
So, $65 a barrel and $1.30 at the pump, no problem, let's focus on helping rebuild notre damn
A couple of cents a liter here and there.......No biggie !
To me a penny here a penny there adds up i think it won’t be long till it’s 1.75 l liter  or more
But we are saving the planet, Bill Nye says " the earth is on fire "
These gas prices are getting ridiculous.
Good thing you bought that Japanese thingy eh.
true dat 50 mpg
With all the Boats and RV's firing up for the summer there's no doubt why the fuel prices go up every spring.
Will it tow yer boat ?
Don’t know yet but it carries a toon
My 15hp Yamaha's don't use much fuel but 91 octane in Noelville is $1.57  here. It adds up that's for sure.
Yah, if only we could get those pesky volcano's around the world to contribute to the carbon tax, our prices would lower overnight! HH
Just came home from Costco in Winona, regular is $1.16 a litre there
Funny how that works eh?  $120 a barrel in 2008 and the pump prices are identical.
Yup, don't know how they figure out the price. Seems to go up 10-15% per year no matter what the price of crude is.   ?
Gas dropped 2 cents over my way today, course it'll probably go up 5 cents tomorrow.
Same here Lew! Suck you in and then spit you out next week.
I'm speechless.

I don't know what is going on around here in Haldimand county. Gas was $1.31 on Monday and today the same Pioneer is $1.24???? Filled up yesterday for $1.08. You know where and I don't care. Better in my jeans than the Govs.
